Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD erred in concluding the marriage was not bona fide
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: IAD questioned genuineness of marriage based on immigration history and cultural interpretation
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section of IRPA on bona fide relationships
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine or entered for immigration benefits
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Totality of evidence including cultural context
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA provisions applicable prior to amendments
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to consider cultural context, overemphasis on immigration history
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Bona fide relationship test under original IRPA framework
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Supportive evidence of cohabitation and communication
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine and not primarily for immigration benefit
Crimes.Application_Factor: Cultural sensitivity in assessing arranged marriages
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Error in factual findings and legal application
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA rules on spousal sponsorship and misrepresentation
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Prior immigration attempts by spouse and perceived lack of genuineness
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to misrepresentation and spousal sponsorship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Overemphasis on immigration history, disregard of cultural evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Alleged failure to fairly assess all evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on authenticity of marital relationship
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to IAD's interpretation of marriage genuineness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Improper application of amended regulations retroactively
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to consider mandatory factors like cultural norms

Crimes.Crime_Name: Marriage Fraud under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD erred due to cultural insensitivity and improper evidence assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: IAD assessed marriage as potentially fraudulent based on Western norms
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section of IRPA on marriage fraud and genuineness
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage entered primarily for immigration benefits
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Conjunctive test for genuineness and intent
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Use of Western standards to assess non-Western marriage practices
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Conjunctive test for bona fide marriage
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Evidence of family involvement and shared future plans
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine and not a means to obtain status
Crimes.Application_Factor: Cultural context in determining marital authenticity
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Error in factual findings and misapplication of legal standard
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA rules on marriage fraud and spousal sponsorship
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remanded for reassessment using original test
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Spouse's immigration history and perceived lack of emotional bond
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections on marriage fraud and admissibility
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Failure to apply correct legal test during assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubt about authenticity of marital relationship
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that IAD applied biased cultural lens
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Improper use of post-amendment standards in pre-amendment case
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to apply conjunctive test in effect at time of appeal
